title: Are AFK scripted players ever going to get banned? [Coop vs AI]

embed.description: Dropbox is a free service that lets you bring your photos, docs, and videos anywhere and share them easily. Never email yourself a file again!

body:
I stopped playing coop vs AI months ago and there were handful of these botting scripts that someone was using, presumably to grind accounts to level 10 to get the Grey Warwick and Medieval Twitch Skins on their main accounts or grind them to 30 and sell them on account.

Any coop vs AI game I play now does is plagued with AFK scripted players on my team, and it has gotten WAY worse, and i can't figure out why. Does Riot not care at all? Like do they generally think it is OK to have people setting up scripts that will play the game for them start to finish then re-queue? Do they have some deal with websites that buy/sell/market summoner accounts? Or some Chinese programmers?

If you have no idea wtf I'm going on about, I made a thread back on the old forums A DAY before boards was released, and there were bucket loads of "JZ _____" prefixed summoner accounts spamming Co vs AI and ARAM. Back then they only took Ghost and Heal, they always went mid, they use summoners and spells randomly, and only chose free rotation champs. Now some of the scripts send them alternating between top, mid and bot, and they start with boots most of the time.



Here is just are some of those threads others STARTED IN 2014:
http://forums.oce.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=87704
http://forums.oce.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=87639
http://forums.oce.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=87441
http://forums.oce.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=87684

Someone sent a support ticket and Riot said they were investigating the issue. 
ONE YEAR AGO.
So in that time, nothing seems to have changed. Around when I play by myself around 5am, that is all the type of players I get when I just want to try out champs with less pressure. It is harder to win one of these games then a ranked game with 2 afkers unless you are playing Katarina or Yasuo.

This is bloody disgraceful. ONE WHOLE YEAR.

replies.body:
As long as there is a market for new, pre-leveled accounts, there will always be bots. Riot does their best to ban them en masse as they come through, but they'll always be out there for a little while before getting caught. Just contribute to getting rid of them by remembering to report them for **Cheating** (make sure it's not just a bad brand new player that doesn't speak english, though).

If you need to report a player outside the post-game lobby, you can submit a [Support Ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).
